page.title: 02HISTORICAL MONUMENTS
page.content: The Vicar,{Rev D.Field,}living in Apperley, controls the 4 churches to help unite the area. Odda's Chapel was dedicated in 1056 and is therefore Saxon with{Romanesque architecture. Originally there were two floors but now only one remains. In 1675, {Odda's {stone,}dedicated to its patron Earl Odda, friend of King Edward the Confessor, was found with Latin and Celtic carved on it. Restoration started in 1933.{Deerhurst Church,}of Saxon origin,is mostly in Gothic style and was part of a Benedictine priory,subordinated in 1469 to Tewkesbury Abbey & dissolved in 1540. Today the Priory is a farm and the parish church was restored in 1861. Chaceley Church has a 12 Century Arch with some registers which date from 1538. Apperley Church is Victorian.
